name: The Femi Company™
overview:
Femi Abodunde is the Founder and President of The Femi Company™, a benefit corporation, working toward certification. The company is a startup management consultancy at seed investment and funding stage.The company is currently focused on building its offerings and assessing early customer interest for those offerings.

Benefit Corporations are a new class of corporation required by law to create a material positive impact on society and the environment.

The Femi Company™ supports small businesses who are embracing the social business model and helps them to drive change toward the end results they wish to achieve. The company specializes at 1) Providing training on organizational behaviors required to cultivate a social culture 2) Implementing software-as-a-service (SaaS) solutions for businesses that deliver unified sales, customer service, human resources and financial management applications designed for the mobile way in which people around the world work today 3) Designing crowdsourcing-as-a-service programs for business management, marketing and Intelligence gathering 4) Creating marketing and PR initiatives based on social networking protocols.

The company relies on the Fortune® 500 business and senior field management expertise of its’ founder to provide strategic business planning, brand stewardship and operational oversight, while leveraging best in class solutions from a network of award winning business, creative and technology professionals.

Femi has been recognized by the Gallup Organization and Marcus Buckingham (New York Times, best selling author) as a best in class management professional.

Some of those he has and/or continues to advise include Kathy Eldon, CEO Creative Visions Foundation and John Roulac, CEO Nutiva Inc. one of America’s fastest growing small businesses by INC., Magazine. Femi has also volunteered time with Social Media Week, Los Angeles, a worldwide event exploring social, cultural and economic impacts of social media.

Areas of expertise include:

Administrative Management Operations Branding, Marketing and Public Relations Financial Management Human Capital Management Payroll Solutions Expense Management Procurement Sales Management Community Relations Supply Chain and Inventory Management
